title: There.Came.an.Echo.REAL.PROPER-PROPHET
description:
There Came an Echo *REAL PROPER* (c) Iridium Studios

release date ...: March 2768
protection .....: Steam
# of discs .....: 1
languages ......: EN

Ender  Wiggin.  Admiral  Ackbar.  That   dude   who
commands  the  G.I.   Joes.   These   totally   rad
commanders knew that  battles  are  won  not  by  a
single footsoldier, but by issuing precise commands
that  put  their  units  in  position  to   achieve
victory. In There Came an  Echo,  follow  in  those
commanders' footsteps by giving  orders  to  Corrin
Webb (Wil Wheaton) and his squadmates in  a  unique
real-time strategy experience.  Using  an  advanced
voice recognition system, direct your units through
a variety of mission types against foes armed  with
futuristic  energy  weaponry  and  personal   force
fields. Make your move with standard commands ("All
units, advance to  Bravo  3!")  or  utilize  custom
variants  to  express   your   unique   personality
("Everyone, do the worm over to Buttface 3!"). Keep
it classy,  folks.  Follow  a  complex,  character-
driven   sci-fi   plot:   Corrin,    an    ordinary
cryptographer, is thrown  into  a  deadly  game  of
secret agendas when a group of  mercenaries  tracks
him down in Santa Monica, California. Guided by the
mysterious Val (Ashly Burch),  Corrin  must  escape
from a foe with seemingly limitless  resources  and
discover   what   secrets   his   own   unbreakable
algorithm,   Radial   Lock,   is    safeguarding...
information that, if released, will rattle the very
foundations of reality itself. Also starring  Laura
Bailey, Yuri Lowenthal,  Cassandra  Morris,  Rachel
Robinson, and Cindy Robinson.

***Note:  There  Came  an  Echo,  though   designed
primarily for voice  commands,  is  fully  playable
without them.***

1- Unpack, burn or mount
2- Install the game (agree on installing all redists
at the end of installation process)
3- Copy the cracked content from PROPHET dir
4- Go To Hell!

PROPER:
CODEX propered DOGE with 100% identical  files  and
with a crack working 100% the same. So why was DOGE
rls  not  working  properly?  Surprise,  it   works
properly when you have the Microsoft Server  Speech
Platform  Runtime  Redists  installed   (they   are
included in DOGE release, but not  run  by  default
after installation). Legit users also  have  issues
when Steam failed to install those  redists,  check
Steam forum. So  after  *Locked  DLCs*,  *Publisher
mistake*  we  also  add  *Redists  not  run   after
installation* to  our  valid  proper  reason  list.
CODEX may be surprised but some  users  have  these
redists installed and DOGE release works  fine  for
them. It's the same like propering for not  running
DirectX or VC++ redists by default (not  all  users
have them installed). So after analysing new proper
standards we decided  that  PROPER  from  CODEX  is
unacceptable. DOGE  release  is  2.41GB,  CODEX  is
7.22GB with same files included, so  it's  3  times
bigger and doesn't fit to  DVD5  anymore.  We  find
unacceptable to proper DVD5  release  with  a  DVD9
containing same files. Also  DVD9  must  be  packed
into 100mb rars, CODEX rls is packed incorrectly in
50mb parts
